place.name: CROCKENHILL
place.gazetteerText: CROCKENHILL, a chapelry in Eynesford and St. Mary-Cray parishes, Kent; near the Mid Kent railway, 1¼ mile SW of Sevenoaks Junction station, and 6½ ESE of Bromley. Post town, Eynesford, under Dartford. Pop., 677. Houses, 121. The chapelry was constituted in 1852. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £100.* Patron, the Archbishop of Canterbury. The church is in the early English style. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
